<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a6566d8c65c03ad2f7b18ed08f0e7f208">setMinFunctionAlignment</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(8));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a4b8c087a490f10055c3401307a857fab">BPFExpandMemcpyInOrder</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LLVM generic code will try to expand memcpy into load/store pairs at this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stage which is before quite a few IR optimization passes, therefore the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loads and stores could potentially be moved apart from each other which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will cause trouble to memcpy pattern matcher inside kernel eBPF JIT</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// compilers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When -bpf-expand-memcpy-in-order specified, we want to defer the expand</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of memcpy to later stage in IR optimization pipeline so those load/store</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pairs won&#39;t be touched and could be kept in order. Hence, we set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MaxStoresPerMem&#42; to zero to disable the generic getMemcpyLoadsAndStores</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// code path, and ask LLVM to use target expander EmitTargetCodeForMemcpy.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a9830bda9bf50bfdab4c10954cc6fb1ac">MaxStoresPerMemset</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a67f472063b7db365d0b5da597871e03d">MaxStoresPerMemsetOptSize</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#aefbee33131c130f8f691c9a482f5fc40">MaxStoresPerMemcpy</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a1695feb44cd6dd30c64697360f1e76d3">MaxStoresPerMemcpyOptSize</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a6d0f43699563375800a45f45bc11ff49">MaxStoresPerMemmove</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a7800cede44a09d00fcc61b9087c20d85">MaxStoresPerMemmoveOptSize</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a3111deca0523de0afcc110cf020ebaaf">MaxLoadsPerMemcmp</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// inline memcpy() for kernel to see explicit copy</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CommonMaxStores =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachineInstrBuilder MIB(&#42;MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ScratchReg;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This function does custom insertion during lowering BPFISD::MEMCPY which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only has two register operands from memcpy semantics, the copy source</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address and the copy destination address.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Because we will expand BPFISD::MEMCPY into load/store pairs, we will need</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a third scratch register to serve as the destination register of load and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// source register of store.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The scratch register here is with the Define | Dead | EarlyClobber flags.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The EarlyClobber flag has the semantic property that the operand it is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// attached to is clobbered before the rest of the inputs are read. Hence it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// must be unique among the operands to the instruction. The Define flag is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// needed to coerce the machine verifier that an Undef value isn&#39;t a problem</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as we anyway is loading memory into it. The Dead flag is needed as the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value in scratch isn&#39;t supposed to be used by any other instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="normal">  ScratchReg = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a>.createVirtualRegister(&amp;BPF::GPRRegClass);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="normal">  MIB.addReg(ScratchReg,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="normal">             <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/regstate/#ade26fe5c9b3fe6948def36f7ca12dfc5a72c17e2ff2d5af62a30e56ac152aa8d5">RegState::Define</a> | <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/regstate/#ade26fe5c9b3fe6948def36f7ca12dfc5a2fee1a7db4e84247a193a9af1f907013">RegState::Dead</a> | <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/regstate/#ade26fe5c9b3fe6948def36f7ca12dfc5acf55f329675ba5045a4863c7a018209b">RegState::EarlyClobber</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewCC;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">switch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a77c69067ae8279bc00ab8757731e90d7">CC</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define SET&#95;NEWCC(X, Y) \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  case ISD::X: \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    if (is32BitCmp &amp;&amp; HasJmp32) \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">      NewCC = isSelectRROp ? BPF::Y##&#95;rr&#95;32 : BPF::Y##&#95;ri&#95;32; \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    else \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">      NewCC = isSelectRROp ? BPF::Y##&#95;rr : BPF::Y##&#95;ri; \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#aff7521dff7b86d6970cbfedfe2b25592">SET&#95;NEWCC</a>(SETGT, JSGT);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#aff7521dff7b86d6970cbfedfe2b25592">SET&#95;NEWCC</a>(SETUGT, JUGT);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#aff7521dff7b86d6970cbfedfe2b25592">SET&#95;NEWCC</a>(SETGE, JSGE);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#aff7521dff7b86d6970cbfedfe2b25592">SET&#95;NEWCC</a>(SETUGE, JUGE);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#aff7521dff7b86d6970cbfedfe2b25592">SET&#95;NEWCC</a>(SETEQ, JEQ);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// eBPF at the moment only has 64-bit comparison. Any 32-bit comparison need</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be promoted, however if the 32-bit comparison operands are destination</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// registers then they are implicitly zero-extended already, there is no</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need of explicit zero-extend sequence for them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We simply do extension for all situations in this method, but we will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// try to remove those unnecessary in BPFMIPeephole pass.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> 0: </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;r+i&quot; or just &quot;i&quot;, depending on HasBaseReg.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
